title: Collaborative Partnership-Based IT Education Design: PBL Projects for Prospective Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic information retrieval and digital tool utilization skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in a blended learning environment utilizing learners' personal devices, involving collaborative design and application of social studies-integrated information technology.

learning_goals: Learners submit ≥5 e-learning module designs incorporating information retrieval, analysis, and knowledge application via collaborative partnership models (e.g., PBL, CoP), achieving ≥80% suitability in peer/expert reviews

Learners analyze 3 academic papers and 2 industry reports using 4 criteria (source credibility, data accuracy, logical consistency, bias), create evaluation tables, and provide ≥80% reliability evidence per source

Graduate students select 3 knowledge dissemination strategies (academia-practice linkage, stakeholder engagement, etc.) for a social studies project (e.g., community development plan), write a 5-page report analyzing applicability, and achieve ≥B grade in peer/instructor feedback
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
